boardgame.name: Pin Pon!
boardgame.description: Warning! The siren has just sounded in the fire station because a fire has just broken out! Can you arrive in time in the co-operative game Pin Pon! to help the firefighters and put out the flames to save the burning house?
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2022 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Enfant Nominee

boardgame.name: Aventurisches Herbarium II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Almost 70 fantastic plants of Aventuria are presented in the Aventurian Herbarium II on one page each in words and pictures. Numerous suggestions for your own adventures around firewalls, kairangeisters and camouflage leaf intrigues invite you to create a green and dangerous Aventuria, where every shrub holds its secrets.

With over 50 simple herbal recipes, the improvisation artists in the players are lured out, while over 20 more alchemical recipes challenge and impress with spectacular effects.

Tables clearly summarize the distribution of the presented plant species. Basic recipes for processing food from the wild and from the field complement the presentation of important cultivated plants and landscapes of Aventuria. As a culmination of the plant world, the sacred plants of the gods and demigods are presented.

A feature on animate landscapes offers game masters six archetypal, ready-to-play settings with a plant focus. An enchanted forest, a spooky forest, a demonic bog, a defensible oasis, an exemplary temple garden with variants for all Twelve Gods, and an academy greenhouse with variants for White, Grey, and Black Mage Guilds all offer their individual challenges. To personalize such settings in the game as needed, the suggested plant occurrences and events can be supplemented with plant creatures. In addition to various woodland shrines for wild settings, Aventurian Herbarium II offers rules for creating plant chimeras as well as an overview of demonic and daimonid plants.

Finally, the game aid is dedicated to magical woods and their processing into traditional artifacts such as personalized wands, rogue toys and co.


Klappentext

Fast 70 phantastische Pflanzen Aventuriens werden im Aventurischen Herbarium II jeweils auf einer Seite in Wort und Bild vorgestellt. Zahlreiche Anregungen für eigene Abenteuer rund um Efeuerwälle, Kairangeister und Tarnblattintrigen laden zur Gestaltung eines grünen und gefährlichen Aventurien ein, in dem jeder Strauch seine Geheimnisse birgt.

Mit über 50 einfachen pflanzlichen Rezepten werden die Improvisationskünstler in den Spielern hervorgelockt, während über 20 weitere alchimistische Rezepte herausfordern und mit spektakulären Wirkungen zu beeindrucken wissen.

Tabellen fassen übersichtlich die Verbreitung der präsentierten Pflanzenarten zusammen. Grundrezepte zur Verarbeitung von Nahrung aus der Wildnis und vom Felde ergänzen die Vorstellung bedeutender Kulturpflanzen und -landschaften Aventuriens. Als Krönung der Pflanzenwelt werden die heiligen Gewächse der Götter und Halbgötter vorgestellt.

Ein Feature zu belebten Landschaften bietet Spielleiterinnen sechs archetypische, spielfertige Settings mit Pflanzenfokus. Ein verwunschener Wald, ein gruseliger Forst, ein dämonisches Moor, eine wehrhafte Oase, ein beispielhafter Tempelgarten mit Varianten für alle Zwölfgötter sowie ein Akademiegewächshaus mit Varianten für Weiße, Graue und Schwarze Magiergilde bieten dabei ihre individuellen Herausforderungen. Um solche Settings im Spiel nach Bedarf zu personalisieren, können die vorgeschlagenen Pflanzenvorkommen und Ereignisse mit Pflanzenwesen ergänzt werden. Neben verschiedenen Waldschraten für wilde Settings bietet das Aventurische Herbarium II Regeln zur Erschaffung von Pflanzenchimären sowie einen Überblick zu dämonischen und daimoniden Pflanzen.

Abschließend widmet sich die Spielhilfe magischen Hölzern und ihrer Verarbeitung zu Traditionsartefakten wie personalisierten Zauberstäben, Schelmenspielzeugen und co.

boardgame.name: Escape the Box: Die verschwundenen Superhelden
boardgame.description: This box transforms into nine rooms - not just one Escape Room, but an entire Superhero Tower stands between you and your Exit. And what is it? The base of the superheroes seems to be abandoned. Time for new heroes to prove themselves. Find the missing heroes and escape the big Escape Room together. Solve all the puzzles and uncover the secrets of the fastest and strongest people in the world to master the mission of your game characters. With up to four players, you'll explore the Heroes' Union base, filled with dangerous artifacts, captured supervillains and alien technology. But don't let the villains hoodwink you. Who knows who is responsible for the disappearance of the superheroes?

boardgame.name: Die Hexe vom Schattenwasser
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Sinister forces are at work in the county of Heldentrutz. People are being kidnapped by harpies, orcs are preparing for a war campaign, and hideous creatures are emerging from the forests and swamps, spreading fear and terror. The citizens of Heldentrutz are sure that only one can be behind these terrible events: the witch of the Shadow Water, who was believed dead.

It will take brave heroes to stop the danger and thwart the plans of the Witch of the Shadow Water. It needs you and your friends!

The expansion set The Witch of the Shadow Water is a supplement to the starter box The Mystery of the Dragon Knight. With this set you can access two new heroes, a witch and a stray, as well as a number of new scenarios and an adventure. In addition, the set contains new rules supplements and a description of Reichsend, the capital of the county of Heldentrutz.


Klappentext

Unheimliche Mächte sind in der Grafschaft Heldentrutz am Werk. Menschen werden von Harpyien entführt, die Orks bereiten sich auf einen Kriegszug vor und aus den Wäldern und Sümpfen treten abscheuliche Wesenheiten hervor und verbreiten Angst und Schrecken. Die Bürger der Heldentrutz sind sich sicher, dass nur eine hinter diesen furchtbaren Ereignissen stecken kann: die totgeglaubte Hexe vom Schattenwasser.

Es braucht tapfere Helden, um die Gefahr zu bannen und die Pläne der Hexe vom Schattenwasser zu durchkreuzen. Es braucht dich und deine Freunde!

Das Erweiterungsset Die Hexe vom Schattenwasser ist eine Ergänzung zur Einsteigerbox Das Geheimnis des Drachenritters. Mit diesem Set kannst du auf zwei neue Helden, eine Hexe und einen Streuner, sowie auf eine Reihe neuer Szenarien und ein Abenteuer zurückgreifen. Zudem enthält das Set neue Regelergänzungen und eine Beschreibung von Reichsend, der Hauptstadt der Grafschaft Heldentrutz.

boardgame.name: Church of Steel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vehicular mayhem in the 41st Millennium

Unveil the mysteries of the Machine Spirit and unleash the massive power of machines of war with Church of Steel, a comprehensive guide to vehicles in Warhammer 40,000: Wrath & Glory. Church of Steel contains rules for more than 80 vehicles from the diverse Factions of the 41st Millennium, and narrative-focused rules for running them in your games.

Take to the Mechanicus workshop to customise your engines of destruction with a panoply of weapons and upgrades, including examinations of Machine Spirits that reside within vehicles of the Imperium. Build a unique history for your venerable vehicle and travel the harsh wastes of the Gilead System with story building travel rules.

Church of Steel includes:

A detailed exploration of the Adeptus Mechanicus and the Machine Cult in the Gilead System, as well as the reverence other factions have for their vehicles.
Rules for customising a vehicle’s appearance and quirks, as well as building a rich history of its exploits.
Information on the nature of Machine Spirits in Imperial vehicles as well as how xenos species view their own vehicles..
Guidance for incorporating travel into your games, from treks across planetary wasteland to journeys through massive hive cities.
Rules for vehicle actions, interactions, and complications in and out of combat
Customisation options for upgrading vehicle performance, adding new wargear, and installing new weapons.
Stats for over a hundred vehicles from tanks, to troop carriers, to personal flyers, including a section on Necron vehicles and the mysterious living metal necrodermis.
Rules for vehicular weaponry and wargear, including massive battle cannons, deadly melee weapons, and powerful means of protection.

boardgame.name: Righteous Champions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A little something extra for your PF2 game!

The magnificent champion class takes the place of the old-school paladin in Pathfinder Second Edition, and we are here with a ton of terrific options to make your champion of good a true holy terror to the bad guys! Unleash the power of the Righteous Swordlord cause with new abilities like Exalt and Sacred Slash, feats like Blessed Iajutsu, Swordswmith's Oath, and Armorer's Aura, and wield three brand-new swords with the consecrate blade focus spell!

boardgame.name: Sky Full of WeaveNet Stars
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this full-colour Deep Space Rescue Plot book for the Broken Shield Roleplaying Game the Deep Space Rescue crew’s lives get made waaaay more complicated when the cast and crew of hit show Deep Space ResQ!!! join their ship for ten days. Can they rescue ships in trouble, while they keep egotistical, unstable actors alive, and also prevent a saboteur from causing mischief?

Inside this book:

Rough Guide To Plots! Broken Shield Plot are designed to be flexible, fun mission settings that give you the support you need to have fun adventures that make the most of Boosts and Complications without railroading your players.
Playing Rescue Characters: As you are not expected to be an expert on space we thought it’d be helpful to list some of the situations various skills can be used.
Rescue Base: Kraken: A suggested base of operations for the team in the Kratos system.
Everything you need to run Sky Full of WeaveNet Stars:
Learn all about egotistical and fragile actor Zaiden Hornick who plays Star-Captain Dash! Aspiring, dedicated actor Sothy Soun who plays Lieutenant Chantrea, and their production team of producer, script writer, SFX guru and camera drone operator.
Background on the assignment, possible Boosts and Complications to make life interesting, stats on key stats and handouts to help you build your own crew.
Four plot seeds to further your adventures.

boardgame.name: Die Gestade des Gottwals - Thorwal & das Gjalskerland
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

On the sea-swept shores of the Godwhale you will find brave seafarers, magical beast warriors and sinister horrors from the night-black depths and days long past, which make the already harsh life in the far north a real challenge.
With this regional game help you receive supplementary background material to Thorwal and the Gjalskerland. Along the northwestern coast of Aventuria, you will travel past rugged fjords and misty islands, through eerie moors and swamps, and into the endless expanses of the barren highlands. Face the orcs that always lurk behind the mountains, as well as the children of the sinister sea serpent Hranngar and the almost forgotten terrors that descend upon Gjalskerland. The shores of the Godwhale are always good for an adventurous journey. That's for sure!
This volume features professions appropriate to the region, including the fabled Gjalsk beast warriors, the hard-hitting Premer warrior women, or the godwhale-guarded worshippers of Swafnir.
Also included are:
- detailed information about the individual regions and their inhabitants, their culture, language and way of life
- an overview of important historical events with starting points for mysteries and adventures
- a Thorwaler Ottajasko, ready for its use at the game table
- backgrounds and focus rules for regional peculiarities like the seafaring of the Thorwaler or the Palenkel of the Gjalsker
- new weapons, armor and equipment, from the Olport toad skin to the bone club of the Gjalsk shamans
- focus rules on the traits of the Thorwaler and Gjalsker, giving your heroes regional flair
- new special skills, spells, rituals, liturgies and ceremonies
- secrets, mysteries and other adventure hooks for the game master
- three A3 maps of the region and maps of the most important cities, including for the first time a Gjalsk settlement


Klappentext

Die Gestade des Gottwals – Thorwal & das Gjalskerland
An den gischtumtosten Gestaden des Gottwals finden sich tapfere Seefahrer, zaubermächtige Tierkriegerinnen und finstere Schrecken aus nachtschwarzen Tiefen und längst vergangenen Tagen, die das ohnehin raue Leben im hohen Norden zu einer wahren Herausforderung machen.
Mit dieser Regionalspielhilfe erhältst du ergänzendes Hintergrundmaterial zu Thorwal und dem Gjalskerland. Entlang der Nordwestküste Aventuriens reist du vorbei an zerklüfteten Fjorden und nebelverhangenen Inseln durch unheimliche Moore und Sümpfe bis in die endlosen Weiten des kargen Hochlands. Stell dich den Orks, die stets hinter den Gebirgen lauern, ebenso wie den Kindern der finsteren Seeschlange Hranngar und den beinahe vergessenen Schrecken, die über das Gjalskerland herfallen. Die Gestade des Gottwals sind immer für eine abenteuerliche Reise gut. Das wohl!
In diesem Band werden zur Region passende Professionen vorgestellt, unter anderem die sagenumwobenen Gjalsker Tierkrieger, die schlagkräftigen Premer Kriegerinnen oder die vom Gottwal behüteten Geweihten des Swafnir.
Daneben sind enthalten:
• ausführliche Informationen zu den einzelnen Regionen und ihren Bewohnern, deren Kultur, Sprache und Lebensart
• eine Übersicht über wichtige geschichtliche Ereignisse mit Anknüpfungspunkten für Mysterien und Abenteuer
• eine Thorwaler Ottajasko, bereit für ihren Einsatz am Spieltisch
• Hintergründe und Fokusregeln für regionale Besonderheiten wie die Seefahrt der Thorwaler oder das Palenkel der Gjalsker
• neue Waffen, Rüstungen und Ausrüstungsgegenstände, von der Olporter Krötenhaut bis zur Knochenkeule der Gjalskerschamanen
• Fokusregeln zu den Wesenszügen der Thorwaler und Gjalsker, die deine Helden mit regionalem Flair versehen
• neue Sonderfertigkeiten, Zauber, Rituale, Liturgien und Zeremonien
• Geheimnisse, Mysterien und andere Abenteueraufhänger für den Spielleiter
• drei A3-Karten der Region und Stadtpläne der wichtigsten Städte, darunter erstmals eine Siedlung der Gjalsker

boardgame.name: Das Heldenbrevier der Gestade des Gottwals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

When the Gyalsk beast warrior Maighread brai Criosaidh discovers that her glorious skin image suspiciously resembles that of an Aran storyteller who has traveled to the highlands of the north in search of material for his stories, and that both skin images contain unknown runes, this circumstance causes her great concern. Together with the storyteller Amud, she goes in search of a powerful Brancha-Dûn, a shaman of her people, to get to the bottom of the matter.
Meanwhile, in the Hjalding city of Thorwal, a similar thing happens to Hjaldar Thorwulfsson, the darling of the Runjas. A Godi, a Thorwalian seer, brings him into contact with the mage Swanhild Norrisdottir from the Hall of Winds in Olport and prophesies a momentous destiny for both of them, which is reflected in the coincidence of their skin images. The search for their destiny leads the four adventurers to venerable Olport. But before glory, the Runjas, revered by the Thorwalians as daughters of Ifirn and goddesses of fate, have put adventure: The Peaceless and pirate Blackaxe has it in for the bearers of the skin images and is doing everything in his power to get hold of them while they fathom the task the gods have in store for them.

---

Klappentext

Als die Gjalsker Tierkriegerin Maighread brai Criosaidh entdeckt, dass ihr ruhmvolles Hautbild verdächtig dem eines aranischen Geschichtenerzählers ähnelt, der auf der Suche nach Stoff für seine Geschichten ins Hochland des Nordens gereist ist, und dass beide Hautbilder unbekannte Runen enthalten, bereitet ihr dieser Umstand große Sorgen. Gemeinsam mit dem Geschichtenerzähler Amud begibt sie sich auf die Suche nach einer mächtigen Brancha-Dûn, einer Schamanin ihres Volkes, um der Sache auf den Grund zu gehen.
Währenddessen widerfährt dem Liebling der Runjas Hjaldar Thorwulfsson in der Hjaldingstadt Thorwal Ähnliches. Ein Godi, ein thorwalscher Seher, bringt ihn mit der Magierin Swanhild Norrisdottir aus der Halle der Winde in Olport in Kontakt und prophezeit beiden ein bedeutsames Schicksal, das sich in der Übereinstimmung ihrer Hautbilder widerspiegelt. Die Suche nach ihrer Bestimmung führt die vier Abenteurer ins ehrwürdige Olport. Doch vor den Ruhm haben die Runjas, die von den Thorwalern als Töchter Ifirns und Göttinnen des Schicksals verehrt werden, das Abenteuer gesetzt: Der Friedlose und Pirat Schwarzaxt hat es auf die Träger der Hautbilder abgesehen und setzt alles daran, ihrer habhaft zu werden, während sie die Aufgabe ergründen, die die Götter für sie vorgesehen haben.

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Crime: 1400 – Wooden Dog Meeple
boardgame.description:
Wooden dog meeple, part of the Chronicles of Crime 1400 launch kit.

Used to track the location of the loyal hound.

boardgame.name: Meadow: Downstream
boardgame.description:
Meadow: Downstream is an expansion for Meadow inspired by the fascinating nature of aquatic environments. Start a new journey to observe flora, fauna and landscapes connected with rivers, streams and lakes. Go kayaking down the river and compete with others on the new fields of exploration.

Meadow: Downstream includes over 80 new cards depicting wildlife living in an aquatic environment and a new thematic envelope to discover. Kayaking mechanism allows players to score extra points for progressing down the river. Adjust the level of competition with two-sided river board. Choose between a fast stream and calm river to explore two faces of nature.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Dominion: Hijs De zeilen (2de editie)
Dominion: Seaside (Second Edition)
Dominion: Terramar (Segunda Edición)
boardgame.description:
Dominion: Seaside is an expansion to both Dominion and Dominion: Intrigue. As such, it does not contain material for a complete game.

From the back of the box: "All you ask is a tall ship and a star to steer her by. And someone who knows how to steer ships using stars. You finally got some of those rivers you'd wanted, and they led to the sea. These are dangerous, pirate-infested waters, and you cautiously send rat-infested ships across them, to establish lucrative trade at far-off merchant-infested ports. First, you will take over some islands, as a foothold. The natives seem friendly enough, crying their peace cries, and giving you spears and poison darts before you are even close enough to accept them properly. When you finally reach those ports you will conquer them, and from there you will look for more rivers.

One day, all the rivers will be yours."

Dominion: Seaside (Second Edition) contains nine new types of Kingdom cards, which will be released on their own as an update pack for those who own the first edition of this expansion. A few cards will receive minor errata, but these will not appear in the update pack.

boardgame.name: Prometheus
boardgame.description:
A 2-player abstract game played on a chess-style board, where opposing pieces (of three distinct kinds: cubes, pyras and tetras) seek to win by capturing the fourth and leader piece of each army: the sphere.

Each piece moves exactly as many squares as it has corners: tetras move three squares, pyras five and cubes eight. No pieces can be jumped, but pieces are captured when an opposing piece ends its' move on the same square. When a sphere is captured, the game is over.

boardgame.name: Rüstkammer der Gestade des Gottwals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

On the sea-swept shores of the Godwhale you will find brave seafarers, magical beast warriors and dark terrors from the night-black depths and days long past, which make the already rough life in the far north a real challenge.

On the icy waves of the northern seas, fearless fishermen and their hailances hunt for the largest sharks in Aventuria. In the ottaskins of the ship communities, muscle-bound rekkers know how to break through any shield wall with an Olport Orknase or how to tackle several enemies at once with a Premer longaxe.

The crudely forged blades of the Gjalsk may not be of the greatest craftsmanship, but the serrated and barbed blade of a Gjalsk barbarian sword can often put an enemy to flight just by looking at it - not to mention the challenge of parrying the powerful blows of such a weapon.

The participants of the Highland Games of Gyalsk know how to use the chain ball like no one else. Hurling this chain weapon as far as possible is one of the disciplines of the Palenkel - but even away from a sporting contest, this unusual weapon can be used in close and long range combat with shattering efficiency, at least if you know how.

The armory of the Shores of the Godwhale contains a large selection of weapons, armor, and other equipment common to Thorwal and the Gjalskerlands.

The temples and sacred sites of northwestern Aventuria also hold many a magical or karmic artifact, such as the swafnir-sacred oarblade of Jurga Tjalfsdottir or the call horns of the mammoth-shaped Natûru-Gon, which are kept in the six primordial haeradi of the Gjalsk. They are mentioned in the present armory as well as the legendary blades Tyrfing and Grimring, the cyclops two-handed sword, which has gone down in the history of Thorwal as the Blade of Destiny.

In addition to very general things like the clothing of a typical Thorwalian woman or what a traveling Gjalsk barbarian carries in his provisions pouch, more details about the crafts on the shores of the Godwhale are included, especially about shipbuilding and the art of skin sculpting.

This volume supplements the regional game aid The Shores of the Godwhale with extensive and generally applicable rules for the special items of the region. Knowledge of the rulebook as well as the Aventurian Almanac is assumed.


Klappentext

An den gischtumtosten Gestaden des Gottwals finden sich tapfere Seefahrer, zaubermächtige Tierkriegerinnen und finstere Schrecken aus nachtschwarzen Tiefen und längst vergangenen Tagen, die das ohnehin raue Leben im hohen Norden zu einer wahren Herausforderung werden lassen.

Auf den eisigen Wogen der nördlichen Meere machen sich furchtlose Fischer mit ihren Hailanzen auf die Jagd nach den größten Haien Aventuriens. In den Ottaskins der Schiffsgemeinschaften wissen muskelbepackte Rekkerinnen, wie man mit einer Olporter Orknase jeden Schildwall durchbricht oder mit der Premer Langaxt gleich mehreren Feinden zu Leibe rückt.

Die grob geschmiedeten Klingen der Gjalsker zeugen vielleicht nicht von allergrößter Handwerkskunst, aber die mit Zacken und Widerhaken versehene Klinge eines Gjalsker Barbarenschwertes vermag häufig allein durch ihren Anblick einen Feind in die Flucht zu schlagen – ganz zu schweigen von der Herausforderung, die es mit sich bringt, die überaus wuchtigen Hiebe einer solchen Waffe zu parieren.

Die Teilnehmenden der Hochlandspiele der Gjalsker verstehen sich wie niemand sonst auf den Umgang mit der Kettenkugel. Diese Kettenwaffe so weit wie möglich zu schleudern, ist eine der Disziplinen des Palenkels – aber auch abseits eines sportlichen Wettkampfes kann die ungewöhnliche Waffe im Nah- und Fernkampf mit zerschmetternder Effizienz eingesetzt werden, zumindest wenn man weiß, wie.

Die Rüstkammer der Gestade des Gottwals enthält eine große Auswahl an Waffen, Rüstungen und anderen Ausrüstungsgegenständen, wie sie in Thorwal und dem Gjalskerland gebräuchlich sind.

Die Tempel und heiligen Stätten im Nordwesten Aventuriens bergen darüber hinaus auch so manches magische oder karmale Artefakt, wie das swafnirheilige Ruderblatt von Jurga Tjalfsdottir oder die Rufhörner des mammutgestaltigen Natûru-Gon, die in den sechs Ur-Haeradi der Gjalsker aufbewahrt werden. Sie finden in der vorliegenden Rüstkammer ebenso Erwähnung wie die legendären Klingen Tyrfing und Grimring, der Zyklopenzweihänder, der als die Schicksalsklinge in die Geschichte Thorwals eingegangen ist.

Neben ganz allgemeinen Dingen wie der Kleidung einer typischen Thorwalerin oder dem, was ein reisender Gjalsker Barbar in seinem Proviantbeutel mit sich führt, sind auch weitere Details zum Handwerk an den Gestaden des Gottwals enthalten, insbesondere zum Thema Schiffsbau und der Kunst der Hautbildstecher.

Dieser Band ergänzt die Regionalspielhilfe Die Gestade des Gottwals mit umfangreichen und allgemeingültigen Regeln für die besonderen Gegenstände der Region. Kenntnisse des Regelwerks sowie des Aventurischen Almanachs werden vorausgesetzt.

boardgame.name: Nacht der Feuertaufe
boardgame.description:
'Publishers blurb

Your little brother is standing next to you at the railing, a stiff breeze blowing in your faces. The sail creaks as your dragon boat dances up and down on the waves. You grip the handle of your axe tighter, clutching a rope with your other hand. Slowly you approach your destination and you feel the anticipation. Ever since you were a little girl and listened to the stories of adults, you have longed for this moment. You wanted to prove yourself, and now the opportunity is near. It is not far now, and then a new life will begin. You are still just a child to the other sailors, but that will change once you leave the ship. The plank is lowered. Finally the time has come! Together with your brother, you storm off the ship and plunge into the hustle and bustle of the harbor. You have been at sea for just under a week, but now it has come, the night of the baptism of fire.

The Night of Baptism by Fire is a solo adventure that lets you venture straight into the adventure without a master or fellow players. You play an Ottajasko recorder, a seafaring fighter from a Thorwalian ship community, and encounter new challenges as you read section after section. All your skills will be needed to escape with your skin intact. You don't need any previous knowledge. A ready-to-play Thorwalian woman to take on this adventure is included at the end of the volume, and all rules and game mechanics are explained right in the book.

On to the adventure!

A solo adventure for a Thorval heroine

Genre: City adventure
Prerequisites: none
Location: Hjalding City Thorwal
Time: any time from 1040 BF
Complexity (player/master): low / -
Experience of heroes: experienced (with own heroine)
Requirements:
Combat 2/4
Crafting 2/4
Physical talents 2/4
Living History 1/4

For a more in-depth look at the game mechanics as well as the background, we recommend the TDE5 rulebook, the Aventurian Almanac as well as the regional game aid The Shores of the Godwhale. However, these volumes are not required to play the adventure, a ready-to-play heroine is included in the adventure.


Dein kleiner Bruder steht neben dir an der Reling, eine steife Brise weht euch ins Gesicht. Das Segel knarzt, während euer Drachenboot auf den Wellen auf und ab tanzt. Du fasst den Griff deiner Axt fester, mit der anderen Hand umklammerst du ein Tau. Langsam nähert ihr euch eurem Ziel und du verspürst die Vorfreude. Schon seit du ein kleines Mädchen warst und den Geschichten der Erwachsenen lauschtest, hast du diesen Moment herbeigesehnt. Du wolltest dich beweisen, und jetzt ist die Gelegenheit nah. Es ist nicht mehr weit, und dann beginnt ein neues Leben. Noch bist du für die anderen Seefahrenden nur ein Kind, aber das wird sich ändern, sobald du das Schiff erst verlassen hast. Die Planke wird herabgelassen. Endlich ist es soweit! Mit deinem Bruder stürmst du von Bord und stürzt dich in das Getümmel des Hafens. Eine knappe Woche wart ihr auf See, doch jetzt ist sie gekommen, die Nacht der Feuertaufe.

Die Nacht der Feuertaufe ist ein Solo-Abenteuer, mit dem du dich ohne Meister und Mitspielende direkt ins Abenteuer wagen kannst. Du spielst eine Ottajasko-Rekkerin, eine seefahrende Kämpferin aus einer thorwalschen Schiffsgemeinschaft, und begegnest beim Lesen Abschnitt für Abschnitt neuen Herausforderungen. All deine Fähigkeiten werden gefragt sein, um mit heiler Haut davonzukommen. Du benötigst keinerlei Vorkenntnisse. Eine spielfertige Thorwalerin, mit der du dieses Abenteuer bestreiten kannst, ist am Ende des Bandes enthalten, und alle Regeln und Spielmechanismen werden direkt im Buch erklärt.

Auf ins Abenteuer!

Ein Solo-Abenteuer für eine Thorwaler Heldin

Genre: Stadtabenteuer
Voraussetzungen: keine
Ort: Hjaldingstadt Thorwal
Zeit: beliebig ab 1040 BF
Komplexität (Spieler/Meister): gering / -
Erfahrung der Helden: erfahren (bei eigener Heldin)
Anforderungen:
Kampf 2/4
Handwerk 2/4
Körpertalente 2/4
Lebendige Geschichte 1/4

Zur Vertiefung der Spielmechaniken sowie des Hintergrundes empfehlen wir das DSA5 Regelwerk, den Aventurischen Almanach sowie die Regionalspielhilfe Die Gestade des Gottwals. Zum Spielen des Abenteuers sind diese Bände jedoch nicht erforderlich, eine spielfertige Heldin ist im Abenteuer enthalten.

boardgame.name: Ruin of Bleak Hill (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mottled Spire’s wild, rugged uplands lie beyond the Selka River. Crumbling ruins and abandoned mines—the leavings of civilisation’s ebbing tide—dot the hills. One such place is the isolated wind-blasted ruin of Bleak Hill Manor. Here once dwelled the wizard-sage Ilmatar Tiera before her untimely death at unknown hands. The centuried ruin—decayed and crumbled—has alternately lain abandoned or served as the lair of marauders, bandits and worse. Now, however, events conspire to focus certain interested parties upon the ruin, and all such folk are in need of adventurers brave enough to dare the terrors of the Mottled Spire.

This Dungeon Backdrop is designed to work with the Ashlar campaign setting but can be easily inserted into almost any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: Torch and Lantern (SW)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dark is dangerous, and full of monsters. Since the dawn of civilization, humans have sought for ways to light their worlds and push back the darkness. Heroes exploring caves, catacombs, and ruins of buried cities bring torches and lanterns to discover ancient treasure and fend off terrible monsters.

Torch and Lantern is all about how we see in the dark. It includes:

A real-world history of human-made lighting
How lighting might change in a fantasy world
7 new pieces of mundane equipment, like fungus lantern and glow goop
New modifiers for the light power
A random light source generator
3 new magic items, like the intelligent lantern Obo the Illuminator
5 new monsters, including living prismatic sphere and radiant drake

boardgame.name: Torch and Lantern (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dark is dangerous, and full of monsters. Since the dawn of civilization, humans have sought for ways to light their worlds and push back the darkness. Heroes exploring caves, catacombs, and ruins of buried cities bring torches and lanterns to discover ancient treasure and fend off terrible monsters.

Torch and Lantern is all about how we see in the dark. It includes:

A real-world history of human-made lighting
How lighting might change in a fantasy world
7 new pieces of mundane equipment, like fungus lantern and glow goop
Optional rules for casting continual flame with higher spell slots
A random light source generator
3 new magic items, like the intelligent lantern Obo the Illuminator
5 new monsters, including living prismatic sphere and radiant drake

boardgame.name: Torch and Lantern (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dark is dangerous, and full of monsters. Since the dawn of civilization, humans have sought for ways to light their worlds and push back the darkness. Heroes exploring caves, catacombs, and ruins of buried cities bring torches and lanterns to discover ancient treasure and fend off terrible monsters.

Torch and Lantern is all about how we see in the dark. It includes:

A real-world history of human-made lighting
How lighting might change in a fantasy world
7 new pieces of mundane equipment, like fungus lantern and glow goop
Optional rules for casting heightened continual flame
A random light source generator
3 new magic items, like the intelligent lantern Obo the Illuminator
5 new monsters, including living prismatic sphere and radiant drake

boardgame.name: Dwarven Depths - Western Garrison
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Western Garrison is more a military academy than a true garrison, although it is able to provide capable soldiers to the nearby Western Outpost. The Western Garrison features a large arena which functions as training area for the rookies. The training area includes a large water pool, a wrestling ring and space for crossbow training as well as throwing axes. The Western Garrison features a large classroom used for teaching military tactics as well as a very large library which keeps the largest collection of military tomes and parchments of the realm. Other features of the garrison include a chapel, barracks, refectory, a very large armory and a recruiting area.

boardgame.name: Dwarven Depths - Western Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Western Outpost is the bulwark which defends the north side of the Rift. The Rift separates the Dwarven Realm from the Goblin Caves on the western side of the mountain. The Western Outpost features deadly corridors lined with traps and arrowslits which proved to be a nightmare for would-be intruders. The nearby Western Garrison povides fresh soldiers whenever the need arises. The Dwarves never actively pushed off the goblins fearing such war would be too demanding in terms of lives, so they prefer to keep the monsters at bay leading them to a stalemate. From time to time the goblins reunites to throw an attack to the outpost, which never succedded.

boardgame.name: Dwarven Depths - Residence Way
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Just south of the Trade Way you can find the Residence way. This place is where the prominent dwarven families live. They are not nobles, but workers and rich businessmen which often host foreign rich merchants in their houses; for this reason the Residence Way stands conveniently on the main dwarven road which links the North and the South Gates. In this section you can find eight houses: Stonefist, Rockhammer, Twinaxes, Goldspark, Diamondgrave, Blackstone, Silverpick and Ironhead.

boardgame.name: Dwarven Depths - Thanes' Tombs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Beyond the Crypts, going eastward, there are the Thanes’ Tombs. Few things in the Dwarven Realm are so magnificent than these tombs. It is said that The tomb of the First Thane required more than 1000 years of stoneworking, and that the materials used in it were unique in the world. The 70ft high mausoleum standing in the middle of a 200ft high gigantic room is entirely covered with crystalline dragonscales, glued together with a translucent web of mithral filaments, thin as the thinnest spiderweb and hard as the harder diamond. The “Hammer” walkway, in which rest the whole honor guard of the First thane is carved from a single, huge slab of obsidian. It is said that a titan of the past brought the gigantic obsidian slab it over its shoulders and gifted it to the dwarves to honor the First Thane.

boardgame.name: Dwarven Depths - Underground Farm
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Just west of the Brewery lies the Underground Farm, a peculiar location where the ingredients (the mushrooms) for the most secret dwarven brewing recipes are found. A large crack on the side of the mountain provides enough sunlight for certain kinds of plants, but even so, most of this giant cavern is dimly lit. The whole site is under the command of the Master Herbalist, also called: “The Mad Herbs Dwarf” who has a laboratory house on the western side of the cavern. A small cart railroad encircles the cavern providing easy mean to bring the herbs into storage houses eastward, ready to be fed to the brewery. The site is dotted with strange locations such as the Petrified Forest, the Hidden Well, the Glowing Pillar and the Ruined Farmhouse.

boardgame.name: Dwarven Depths - Grand Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Straight after the Minor Temples area, going eastward, lies the Grand Temple. No one but those who visited it, can ever describe the greatness and the beauty of this temple dedicated to the Stone God. A grand church featuring a huge statue of the Stone God dominates the area. Great black stone pillars, finely crafted with detailed bas-reliefs and unique stonework rise up to the ceiling, which is so high that cannot be seen. Many prayer areas dot the grand church. The floor is a mastodontic stone slab carved with millions of bas-reliefs, brought into place by no other than the Stone God itself, legend tells. Many side rooms, accessible through secret doors, feature hidden libraries, sacred forges and barracks of Stone God templars, an elite priests’ group that sworn obedience to the Stone God.

boardgame.name: Dark Shadows Rising Chapters 1 & 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

On the Western edge of Baraben a wizard of dark shadows and necromancy once held sway. From a citadel in the middle of Starry Lake his influence and armies of undead spread for many miles in each direction before an order of paladins destroyed him. Now, over a hundred years later, corpses have begun to disappear from their graves, merchant trains have begun to go missing, and goblins branded with the symbol of Hazsharad the Dark have once more been seen.

A band of adventurers, brave or foolhardy enough to investigate this threat must be sought. Will you be a member of this group? This could be the start of a long and fruitful adventuring career, with fame and fortune aplenty. Of course, it might be a very short-lived career.

This product contains the first two chapters of Dark Shadows Rising, a unique campaign starting at levels 1-2. It covers the local town, NPCs and monsters, and will involve the PCs in adventure, intrigue, and danger over different kingdoms both exotic and dangerous. Fortune and Glory is there for the taking by those that dare.

boardgame.name: Lost Mammoth Valley
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With danger close behind, the Broken Tusks journey through the bountiful but treacherous Lost Mammoth Valley in search of the Primordial Flame. The Tusks’ scouts will need to solve the riddles of the ancient valley and recruit a motley league of followers, all while evading the watchful gaze of the vale’s villainous overlords and unraveling a legendary artifact’s mythical past.

boardgame.name: Burning Tundra
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Broken Tusks find sanctuary at last in the settlement of Hillcross, but invading frost giants quickly force the clan's scouts to lead their mighty following's defense against the siege and take on new titles. To put a stop to the slaughter, the newly named Mammoth Lords take the fight to their foes by riding their bestial mounts through the sucking muck of the Tamarnian Tar Forest. At the heart of these black woods, amid the ruins of a half-sunken crusaders' castle, the heroes wield the sacred light of the Primordial Flame to defeat their ancient enemies once and for all.

boardgame.name: Shadows of the Ancients
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Save the Magaambya! The heroes return to the Magaambya magic academy to find the villain they'd vanquished on a distant planet had set another scheme in motion long ago. Students and teachers have been twisted by evil magic, and the heroes must engage in legendary tests to gain the means to free them. While a monstrous foe thrashes through the Magaambya, it's up to the heroes to save the school from utter destruction!

boardgame.name: Quest for the Frozen Flame Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The herd is on the move. The hunt is on!

In the brutal tundra of the Realm of the Mammoth Lords, only the hardiest folk have what it takes to withstand unsparing weather, track down big game, and fight back hostile followings. The Broken Tusk following has survived another winter, but a new year just began, and signs of danger foretell a year unlike any before.

Unless their newest party of scouts can secure a safe route through the wilds, saber-toothed beasts, warmongering rivals, and the ever-looming possibility of natural disaster all threaten to end an ancient people’s legacy. Will the Broken Tusks succumb to the elements and surrender to their rivals? Or will you guide your following to glory and reclaim a stolen birthright?

boardgame.name: Untamed: Feral Factions – Spirit Strike edition
boardgame.description:
This standalone edition increases player factions to 12 allowing up to 4 players to play but includes no rules changes from the original edition.

The Deluxe Edition includes everything from the Spirit Strike Edition, however all your cards are foil (only available in this edition). The box also includes card sleeves, a metal first player token, a collector's artbook, a box sleeve, and a special foil-stamped box!

boardgame.name: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Hydra Resurrection
boardgame.description:
As the chaos between living and zombie heroes rages on, the Red Skull attempts to seize power by commanding a legion of zombie Hydra Troops. Well trained and well armed, this horde will pose a threat to Super Heroes and Zombie Heroes alike.

Red Skull is a unique Enemy spawn that can be added to any Mission, although this expansion does feature several of its own, for both game modes! When spawned, he will make use of his unique Action deck, which dictates the special actions he will perform each time he activates.

The six tiles contained in this expansion recreate a different location on each of their sides. On one side is the S.H.I.E.L.D. Helicarrier, and on the other side is the Hydra base. Additional Super Heroes, Zombie Heroes, and Bystanders can also be added to any game of Marvel Zombies.

–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Tile Set

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q2 2023*** Contents: Kickstarter Exclusive Marvel Zombies Hydra Resurrection Board Game Expansion by CMON. Includes 25 Character pieces, 6 Double sided tiles, 8 Super hero cards, 8 Zombie Hero cards, 4 Bystander cards, 6 Red Skull Action cards, 12 Hydra Troop Spawn cards, and 3 cannister tokens. Not a complete game. Requires Marvel Zombies to play (sold separately). Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: The Last Seder Passover Hagaddah
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A passover Haggadah designed for the live action roleplaying game "The Last Seder," but which can be used for seders in general. Contains sheet music and lyrics for the Four Questions, Dayenu, and Eliyahu Ha'Navi.

boardgame.name: They Came From the Snake-Filled Submarine!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Snakes are bad news at the best of times, but nobody wants snakes in their submarine. Nobody but a Director of They Came From Beneath the Sea!, that is!

Embrace the havoc of a snake-filled submarine with this fully playable They Came From Beneath the Sea! scenario, which includes:

Five playable protagonists to DIVE DIVE DIVE right into the action!
Three nasty reptilians representing different snakey threats!
A full plot to explore and run, perfect for one-shots and convention play!
boardgame.rpg: They Came From Beneath the Sea!

boardgame.name: __________ the Vampire Slayer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You have all been invited to the social event of the year – the famous annual murder mystery dinner hosted by Count Strahd von Zarovich. This year’s event is especially exciting because he is introducing his dazzlingly beautiful, and shockingly young, new bride Tatyana into society. Dress to impress, arrive fashionably late, and prepare for an evening you’ll never forget!
boardgame.rpghonor: 2022 RPG Geek 24 Hour Dungeon 1st Place Winner

boardgame.name: Pathfinder: Level 20
boardgame.description:
"I need just a few XP to hit level 20. There better be some kobolds down there!" Here you are, minding your own business with some of your best friends, enjoying the leftover scraps buried in the filth of your cave, when you hear a human curse as they knock some rocks free and then you hear the most terrifying words you've ever heard. Words spoken of in legend. You thought they were just a myth to scare young kobolds into obedience.

In Pathfinder: Level 20, players take on the role of kobolds in their den, scampering away from a 19th level fighter who needs only five XP to hit level 20. They will stop at nothing until they kill a few kobolds and hit that magical gateway that leads them to near divine levels of power.

On your turn, you play cards to help avoid the fighters, run away, and do everything you can to put obstacles (or other players!) between yourself and the humans. Your goal is to not be the kobold at the end of the fighter’s sword, with the game ending either with one surviving player or else with the fighters being forced to flee in shame!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Complete and like new. Shipping $12 in the Us only.

boardgame.name: Air Scarmush: Tactical Flight Contest
boardgame.description:
A hybrid board/app tactical air combat game for two players that runs on a ‘simultaneous turn by turn’ basis over a board of hexagons (board and pawns to print and assemble yourself). The app allows you to choose your next manoeuvre/action with a simple tap on the screen. The movement options available for a given turn are based on the manoeuvre that has been performed previously, which opens or closes opportunities. The app contains the game manual, the scenarios, a link to the pdf document to print and shape and the user interface used to select and present the different manoeuvres and actions.

Each aircraft type has a specific flight model based on the laws of dynamics (official turn charts) that allows them to fly on the game board in a realistic way. The resolution of offensive actions takes into account the position/attitude of the planes and evasive manoeuvres in determining success.

Each game turn represents 8 seconds of flight time, which allows complex manoeuvres such as Immelmann, Split S, High yo-yo or Barrel roll to be performed in sequence.

The game features 20 scenarios (involving 1 to 9 aircraft) that include air-to-air and/or air-to-ground objectives, 5 aircraft types (fighter, interceptor, ground attack, bomber, transport) and 11 weapon/action types (cannon, missiles, bombs, countermeasures,...). Each scenario offers a number of points to be won by each team, the one that has won the most points wins the battle.

boardgame.name: Lotti Karotti Deluxe
boardgame.description:
Limited Edition to celebrate 20 years of Lotti Karotti. This version icludes 3 new features (bridge, gate and mole) as well as shiny bunny miniatures.

The first player to get one of their bunnies to the top of the hill wins. Each turn players draw a card which either has them move one of their bunnies or rotate the carrot at the top of the board which will cause holes to open and close on the game board. Any bunny that lands on an open hole, or has a hole open up underneath them, drops under the board. If a player loses all 4 of their bunnies, they are out of the game.

boardgame.name: Towering Purrfection
boardgame.description: You have stumbled upon an abandoned warehouse overrun with playful and pleasant cats. Your task is to turn the warehouse into a sanctuary for your cats to climb and play in. You will each utilize colorful tiles and cat trees to turn the warehouse into a bright, cozy environment for your cats to climb and enjoy. You are in charge of the renovation, so each tower build is unique to its designer—but remember, these cats accept nothing but purrfection.

boardgame.name: Mythic Mayhem: Forge of Heroes
boardgame.description:
Mythic Mayhem: Forge of Heroes is the core game release from the Mythic Mayhem saga. A battle card game with heroes like Rangar the Barbarian and Kieran Darkheart the Wizard, among others. There are 87 unique cards with a total of 250 playing cards within the deck, perfectly balanced for play for 2+! Some cards are rarer to have in your hand than others, so play them wisely!

This card game has one sole purpose, to play! We took all the elements of the most popular trading card games and made it simple and affordable for anyone to start playing. You do not need to know complicated deck building systems or spend hundreds of dollars on trying to get the best cards. Perfect for playing with friends or family, anyone can learn quickly. All the cards needed to play the game are within the game box!

Mythic Mayhem challenges and changes the definition of trading card gaming. Recently, there has been a disconnect between collectors and players and this game brings everyone together. With exceptional art, holographic legendary cards, and smooth game mechanics we hope to reach as many players as possible!

There are Heroes, spells, attacks, defense cards, and more! This is a game of skill, strategy, and chance. We are dedicated to the creation of a smooth, entertaining, and intriguing game that can be played round after round with various outcomes!

Setup

1. Shuffle the cards; Place all cards face down, instant cards and battle cards in separate decks
2. Each player starts with 20 life points
3. Each player draws 8 cards from the battle deck
4. Each player rolls the die. The highest roll starts; turns go in clockwise order

Details

1. One card can be played per turn, unless otherwise stated on specific card
2. Cannot heal for more than starting life points, unless otherwise stated on specific card
3. A card can be played toward any opponent, unless otherwise stated on specific card
4. Cards are played face up in front of the player until the card mechanics have played out; then discard card to the graveyard
5. Defense cards can be played anytime to defend against damage if the defense card is a reaction; otherwise, it is played for turn; A defense
reaction does not count for turn
6. One defense card can be active per player
7. If defending, any remaining damage not defended is taken
8. Instant cards must be played at time of pulling; instant card effects and damage cannot be blocked
9. A player cannot draw an instant card two turns in a row
10. Instant cards have a separate playing deck and graveyard than all other cards
11. If a player uses all 8 cards in their hand; add 2 life points and redraw 8 cards
12. If there are no available cards in the battle deck or instant deck, shuffle all of the graveyard cards, and place face down to continue the
game

Let's Play!

For turn, choose one of the following options

1. Play a damage, defense, or spell card
OR
2. Draw and play an instant card
OR
3. Discard 1 card from your hand to the graveyard and draw two cards from the battle deck for your hand

To Win

Deplete all opponents' life points

boardgame.name: Forbidden Brews
boardgame.description: You drop the final ingredient into your bubbling cauldron, and see the colors shift as your brew is complete. This potion could make you a pretty penny, even more so since the King outlawed them. You hear a knock at your door, increasing in tempo—the King’s Guard! In this press-your-luck deck builder, players attempt to brew powerful potions while avoiding the King’s Guard in order to collect the most fame and become the greatest witch in all the land! Potion Commotion will be released after Towering Purrfection, so keep an eye out in the future for more news about this dangerously magical deck builder.

boardgame.name: Bear Stare Down: Parks Expansion
boardgame.description: This Parks themed expansion includes 20 cards that can be used to expand your Bear Stare Down game to add 2 more players. Simply add this expansion to the base deck.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Bear Stare Down: The Card Game

boardgame.name: Taste of Power: The Metaphysical Revolution
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Taste of Power! This module, The Metaphysical Revolution, is intended to be difficult for a party of 5 or 6 level 1 characters.
...
The world of Yevir isn’t your standard fantasy world. Standard fantasy would start the group in or near a tavern from the employ of a mysterious stranger or a royal official or a dying creature. This town or tavern would be in or near a forest. A level 1 mission would most likely involve slaying (or avoiding) rats, bandits/raiders, skeletons, zombies, goblinoids, or/and kobolds. In my humble opinion: Yawn.

Instead, the world of Yevir focuses on things not often seen in a fantasy setting. This module is called The Metaphysical Revolution for good reason. Among other things, Yevir is meant to showcase what would happen if Earth’s Industrial Revolution happened with magic and psionics instead of scientific technology. Also, the setting is intended to change due to people, y’know, doing stuff. (Player characters, especially.)

New magic is researched. New item creation methods are discovered. No Medieval Stasis, here!

In Yevir, 50 years is a long time because, as real-world humans, we typically don’t care about what happened more than 50 years ago. Also, things change rapidly in the setting. By the time the group is level 10, space travel isn’t out of the question. (Interplanar travel is still available, of course.)

The world of Yevir is much like our own world. Morality isn’t so absolute. There is plenty of grey. As such, this world is filled with difficult decisions and people who need to make them.

User summary:

This campaign of scenarios is published in several documents:

232-page PDF scenario
56-page PDF players guide
3-page PDF print-and-play handouts
twenty-six PNG files (illustrations, icons, and maps)
one JPG file (illustration)

boardgame.name: フラグのいけにえ (Flag no Ikenie)
boardgame.description:
フラグのいけにえ (Flag no Ikenie) is a bluffing and deduction game from Japan.

The game title refers to a character in a movie who is marked for death (flag sacrifice). Like the cop on the last day before retirement, or the young woman hearing a noise in the cellar. You know they are going to get it, you just don't know how.

In the game, these characters are hidden as Prey cards, and players are the villains in horror movies, hunting them. Player hunt by put numbered cards against the Prey cards to reveal them. Cards are played in sequence, and if the total is 6, the player may check the card to see if it is their own target. At 10, the card is revealed to all.

Each hunter has a special ability that helps them catch their targets. But the prey characters also have special skills to resist the hunter and slip away.

The first player to catch two of their targets is the winner.

boardgame.name: Thunder Road: Vendetta – Extra Ammo Mini-Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Sometimes you just need a little more firepower. Extra Ammo is a deck of bonus mini-expansions for your game. As we unlock more stretch goals, the ammo box gets bigger. And the best part? It's free to all backers who get the game (base or Maximum Chrome edition).

Road Conditions - We race rain or shine! Global effects that impact racers on each road board.
(Blockaded, Guardrails, Marauders, Sand Storm, Slick Roads, Torrential Downpour, Tremors, Windy)

Advanced Airstrikes - Bonus effects for your chopper. Keep one eye on the road and one on the sky.
(Air-to-Air Missile, Bag of Wrenches, Care Package, Discerning Pilot, Dual Guns, Low Flying, Scouting Mission, Strafing Run, Target Practice, Trick Shot)

One Shots - Potent, one-use abilities. Choosing precisely the right time to flip the switch on your flux capacitor can mean the difference between winning and dying.
(AI Danger Avoidance, Camouflage Coating, Flux Capacitor, Grapeshot, Guided Missile, Sonar Array)

Bonus Commands - Extra command board options to choose from, wisely.
(Hands-Free, Nav System, Positraction, Rapid Reload, Rocket Fuel, Targeting AI, Tire Spikes, Torque Booster)

Bounties - Hidden personal achievements that offer an immediate, powerful effect.
(Down and Dirty, Hit and Run, Pinball Wizard, Rubbing is Racing, Slow and Steady)

(8 more, total 45 cards)

boardgame.name: Thunder Road: Vendetta – Maximum Chrome
boardgame.description:
This edition puts all of the game play extras in one big, foil-stamped box:

Base Game
Big Rig and the Final 5
Carnage at Devil's Run
Choppe Shoppe
Extra Ammo


Plus:

Custom plastic insert
Stretch Goals
Exclusive Crew Leader Em Berco
Exclusive mini-expansion German Engineering
Exclusive consolidated rulebook


(From update #13):
Maximum Chrome includes the base game and all three expansions: ''Big Rig & the Final 5'', ''Carnage at Devil's Run'', and ''Choppe Shoppe''. It includes the ''Extra Ammo'' mini-expansion pack. It also includes three items only available in this edition. The German Engineering mini-expansion offers a new way to play, replacing the movement and shooting dice with a hand of cards. The Em Berco crew leader mixes features from Choppe Shoppe and Carnage for a blazing good time. And you also get a consolidated rulebook that incorporates the rules for all the game content in one place with appropriate cross-references for ease of use. And it all comes stored in a custom plastic insert to hold everything in place and a foil-stamped box that looks extra swanky.

Maximum Chrome will not be going into retail distribution.
